column4: anyone know where to go with this: http://pastebin.com/m76c7f1d    its a make error from alsa.
just a wild stab, but you may need the -dev package for alsa.
libasound2-dev
what sort of trouble you having w/ alsa?  sorry, didn't catch your problem.
what's going on w/ alsa?  why you need to compile?
i understand.
what sound card?
http://www.alsa-project.org/alsa-doc/doc-php/template.php?company=Intel&card=ICH+southbridge+HD-audio+and+modem.&chip=ICH6%2C+ICH6M%2C+ICH7%2C+ESB2&module=hda-intel
echo "options snd-hda-intel position_fix=1 model=3stack" | sudo tee -a /etc/modprobe.d/alsa-base
try that.  and reboot.
what exactly does that do?
it's the magic.  :)  no.  it just adds an option to your alsa configuration that may fix it.  it's helped me in the past.  i have one other thing you can try, if that doesn't work.
okie dokie... if this works, im gonna be kinda pissed at the 300megs of crap i just installed trying to compile the drivers. :P
that made it worse... my computer doesnt even pretend to have sound anymore. i click on the sound icon at the top and get a huge error message about how i dont have GStreamer
most likely that's come about via your compiling adventures, not a simple options appendage.
but you can always remove it.  sudo nano /etc/modprobe.d/alsa-base and delte the last line.
nothing successfully compiled, so how?
have you tried this howto?  https://help.ubuntu.com/community/HdaIntelSoundHowto
i told you how to remove that little option.  so stop complaining.  perhaps try out a livecd of another distro, to see if any distro supports your sound card.
sudo nano /etc/modprobe.d/alsa-base.  it'll be the very last line.
behaving?
minor, one i had options before that, and i was booting in kernel 386 (i was reaching) your option may have fixed it... so far so good, but i've had it last for quite some time once before.
not to mention it sounds alot better then when it was working before. so my fingers are crossed. Thanks.
